Events.html: 472 – After being besieged in Rome by his own generals, Western Roman Emperor Anthemius is captured in the St. Peter's Basilica and put to death.
Events.text: After being besieged in Rome by his own generals, Western Roman Emperor Anthemius is captured in the St. Peter's Basilica and put to death.

Events.html: 911 – Signing of the Treaty of Saint-Clair-sur-Epte between Charles the Simple and Rollo of Normandy.
Events.text: Signing of the Treaty of Saint-Clair-sur-Epte between Charles the Simple and Rollo of Normandy.

Events.html: 1174 – Baldwin IV, 13, becomes King of Jerusalem, with Raymond III, Count of Tripoli as regent and William of Tyre as chancellor.
Events.text: Baldwin IV, 13, becomes King of Jerusalem, with Raymond III, Count of Tripoli as regent and William of Tyre as chancellor.

Events.html: 1302 – Battle of the Golden Spurs (Guldensporenslag in Dutch) – a coalition around the Flemish cities defeats the king of France's royal army.
Events.text: Battle of the Golden Spurs (Guldensporenslag in Dutch) – a coalition around the Flemish cities defeats the king of France's royal army.

Events.html: 1346 – Charles IV, Count of Luxembourg and King of Bohemia, is elected King of the Romans.
Events.text: Charles IV, Count of Luxembourg and King of Bohemia, is elected King of the Romans.

Events.html: 1405 – Ming admiral Zheng He sets sail to explore the world for the first time.
Events.text: Ming admiral Zheng He sets sail to explore the world for the first time.

Events.html: 1476 – Giuliano della Rovere is appointed bishop of Coutances.
Events.text: Giuliano della Rovere is appointed bishop of Coutances.

Events.html: 1576 – Martin Frobisher sights Greenland.
Events.text: Martin Frobisher sights Greenland.

Events.html: 1616 – Samuel de Champlain returns to Quebec.
Events.text: Samuel de Champlain returns to Quebec.

Events.html: 1735 – Mathematical calculations suggest that it is on this day that dwarf planet Pluto moved inside the orbit of Neptune for the last time before 1979.
Events.text: Mathematical calculations suggest that it is on this day that dwarf planet Pluto moved inside the orbit of Neptune for the last time before 1979.

Events.html: 1740 – Pogrom: Jews are expelled from Little Russia.
Events.text: Pogrom: Jews are expelled from Little Russia.

Events.html: 1750 – Halifax, Nova Scotia is almost completely destroyed by fire.
Events.text: Halifax, Nova Scotia is almost completely destroyed by fire.

Events.html: 1789 – Jacques Necker is dismissed as France's Finance Minister sparking the Storming of the Bastille.
Events.text: Jacques Necker is dismissed as France's Finance Minister sparking the Storming of the Bastille.

Events.html: 1796 – The United States takes possession of Detroit from Great Britain under terms of the Jay Treaty.
Events.text: The United States takes possession of Detroit from Great Britain under terms of the Jay Treaty.

Events.html: 1798 – The United States Marine Corps is re-established; they had been disbanded after the American Revolutionary War.
Events.text: The United States Marine Corps is re-established; they had been disbanded after the American Revolutionary War.

Events.html: 1801 – French astronomer Jean-Louis Pons makes his first comet discovery. In the next 27 years he discovers another 36 comets, more than any other person in history.
Events.text: French astronomer Jean-Louis Pons makes his first comet discovery. In the next 27 years he discovers another 36 comets, more than any other person in history.

Events.html: 1804 – A duel occurs in which the Vice President of the United States Aaron Burr mortally wounds former Secretary of the Treasury Alexander Hamilton.
Events.text: A duel occurs in which the Vice President of the United States Aaron Burr mortally wounds former Secretary of the Treasury Alexander Hamilton.

links.subject: Vice President of the United States
links.title: Vice President of the United States

links.subject: Secretary of the Treasury
links.title: United States Secretary of the Treasury

Events.html: 1833 – Noongar Australian aboriginal warrior Yagan, wanted for the murder of white colonists in Western Australia, is killed.
Events.text: Noongar Australian aboriginal warrior Yagan, wanted for the murder of white colonists in Western Australia, is killed.

Events.html: 1848 – Waterloo railway station in London opens.
Events.text: Waterloo railway station in London opens.

Events.html: 1864 – American Civil War: Battle of Fort Stevens; Confederate forces attempt to invade Washington, D.C.
Events.text: American Civil War: Battle of Fort Stevens; Confederate forces attempt to invade Washington, D.C.

Events.html: 1882 – The British Mediterranean Fleet begins the Bombardment of Alexandria in Egypt as part of the Anglo-Egyptian War.
Events.text: The British Mediterranean Fleet begins the Bombardment of Alexandria in Egypt as part of the Anglo-Egyptian War.

Events.html: 1889 – Tijuana, Mexico, is founded.
Events.text: Tijuana, Mexico, is founded.

Events.html: 1893 – The first cultured pearl is obtained by Kokichi Mikimoto.
Events.text: The first cultured pearl is obtained by Kokichi Mikimoto.

Events.html: 1893 – A revolution led by the liberal general and politician, José Santos Zelaya, takes over state power in Nicaragua.
Events.text: A revolution led by the liberal general and politician, José Santos Zelaya, takes over state power in Nicaragua.

Events.html: 1895 – Brothers Auguste and Louis Lumière demonstrate movie film technology to scientists.
Events.text: Brothers Auguste and Louis Lumière demonstrate movie film technology to scientists.

Events.html: 1897 – Salomon August Andrée leaves Spitsbergen to attempt to reach the North Pole by balloon. He later crashes and dies.
Events.text: Salomon August Andrée leaves Spitsbergen to attempt to reach the North Pole by balloon. He later crashes and dies.

Events.html: 1906 – Murder of Grace Brown by Chester Gillette in the United States, inspiration for Theodore Dreiser's An American Tragedy.
Events.text: Murder of Grace Brown by Chester Gillette in the United States, inspiration for Theodore Dreiser's An American Tragedy.

Events.html: 1914 – Babe Ruth makes his debut in Major League Baseball.
Events.text: Babe Ruth makes his debut in Major League Baseball.

Events.html: 1914 – USS Nevada (BB-36) is launched.
Events.text: USS Nevada (BB-36) is launched.

Events.html: 1919 – The eight-hour day and free Sunday become law for workers in the Netherlands.
Events.text: The eight-hour day and free Sunday become law for workers in the Netherlands.

Events.html: 1920 – In the East Prussian plebiscite the local populace decides to remain with Weimar Germany.
Events.text: In the East Prussian plebiscite the local populace decides to remain with Weimar Germany.

Events.html: 1921 – A truce in the Irish War of Independence comes into effect.
Events.text: A truce in the Irish War of Independence comes into effect.

Events.html: 1921 – The Red Army captures Mongolia from the White Army and establishes the Mongolian People's Republic.
Events.text: The Red Army captures Mongolia from the White Army and establishes the Mongolian People's Republic.

Events.html: 1921 – Former President of the United States William Howard Taft is sworn in as 10th Chief Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court, becoming the only person ever to hold both offices.
Events.text: Former President of the United States William Howard Taft is sworn in as 10th Chief Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court, becoming the only person ever to hold both offices.

links.subject: Chief Justice
links.title: Chief Justice of the United States

links.subject: U.S. Supreme Court
links.title: Supreme Court of the United States

Events.html: 1922 – The Hollywood Bowl opens.
Events.text: The Hollywood Bowl opens.

Events.html: 1924 – Eric Liddell won the gold medal in 400m at the 1924 Paris Olympics, after refusing to run in the heats for 100m, his favoured distance, on the Sunday
Events.text: Eric Liddell won the gold medal in 400m at the 1924 Paris Olympics, after refusing to run in the heats for 100m, his favoured distance, on the Sunday

Events.html: 1930 – Australian cricketer Donald Bradman scores a world record 309 runs in one day, on his way to the highest individual Test innings of 334, during a Test match against England.
Events.text: Australian cricketer Donald Bradman scores a world record 309 runs in one day, on his way to the highest individual Test innings of 334, during a Test match against England.

Events.html: 1934 – Engelbert Zaschka of Germany flies his large human-powered aircraft, the Zaschka Human-Power Aircraft, about 20 meters at Berlin Tempelhof Airport without assisted take off.
Events.text: Engelbert Zaschka of Germany flies his large human-powered aircraft, the Zaschka Human-Power Aircraft, about 20 meters at Berlin Tempelhof Airport without assisted take off.

Events.html: 1936 – The Triborough Bridge in New York City is opened to traffic.
Events.text: The Triborough Bridge in New York City is opened to traffic.

Events.html: 1940 – World War II: Vichy France regime is formally established. Philippe Pétain becomes Prime Minister of France.
Events.text: World War II: Vichy France regime is formally established. Philippe Pétain becomes Prime Minister of France.

Events.html: 1943 – Massacres of Poles in Volhynia and Eastern Galicia by the Ukrainian Insurgent Army within the Reichskommissariat Ukraine (Volhynia) peak.
Events.text: Massacres of Poles in Volhynia and Eastern Galicia by the Ukrainian Insurgent Army within the Reichskommissariat Ukraine (Volhynia) peak.

links.subject: Massacres of Poles in Volhynia and Eastern Galicia
links.title: Massacres of Poles in Volhynia and Eastern Galicia

Events.html: 1943 – World War II: Allied invasion of Sicily – German and Italian troops launch a counter-attack on Allied forces in Sicily.
Events.text: World War II: Allied invasion of Sicily – German and Italian troops launch a counter-attack on Allied forces in Sicily.

Events.html: 1947 – The Exodus 1947 heads to Palestine from France.
Events.text: The Exodus 1947 heads to Palestine from France.

Events.html: 1950 – Pakistan joins the International Monetary Fund and the International Bank.
Events.text: Pakistan joins the International Monetary Fund and the International Bank.

Events.html: 1957 – Prince Karim Husseini Aga Khan IV inherits the office of Imamat as the 49th Imam of Shia Imami Ismaili worldwide, after the death of Sir Sultan Mahommed Shah Aga Khan III.
Events.text: Prince Karim Husseini Aga Khan IV inherits the office of Imamat as the 49th Imam of Shia Imami Ismaili worldwide, after the death of Sir Sultan Mahommed Shah Aga Khan III.

Events.html: 1960 – France legislates for the independence of Dahomey (later Benin), Upper Volta (later Burkina) and Niger.
Events.text: France legislates for the independence of Dahomey (later Benin), Upper Volta (later Burkina) and Niger.

Events.html: 1960 – Congo Crisis: The State of Katanga breaks away from the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
Events.text: Congo Crisis: The State of Katanga breaks away from the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

Events.html: 1960 – To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee is first published, in the United States.
Events.text: To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee is first published, in the United States.

Events.html: 1962 – First transatlantic satellite television transmission.
Events.text: First transatlantic satellite television transmission.

Events.html: 1962 – Project Apollo: At a press conference, NASA announces lunar orbit rendezvous as the means to land astronauts on the Moon, and return them to Earth.
Events.text: Project Apollo: At a press conference, NASA announces lunar orbit rendezvous as the means to land astronauts on the Moon, and return them to Earth.

Events.html: 1971 – Copper mines in Chile are nationalized.
Events.text: Copper mines in Chile are nationalized.

Events.html: 1972 – The first game of the World Chess Championship 1972 between challenger Bobby Fischer and defending champion Boris Spassky starts.
Events.text: The first game of the World Chess Championship 1972 between challenger Bobby Fischer and defending champion Boris Spassky starts.

Events.html: 1973 – Varig Flight 820 crashes near Paris, France on approach to Orly Airport, killing 123 of the 134 on board. In response, the FAA bans smoking on flights.
Events.text: Varig Flight 820 crashes near Paris, France on approach to Orly Airport, killing 123 of the 134 on board. In response, the FAA bans smoking on flights.

Events.html: 1977 – Martin Luther King, Jr. is posthumously awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom.
Events.text: Martin Luther King, Jr. is posthumously awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

Events.html: 1978 – Los Alfaques Disaster: A truck carrying liquid gas crashes and explodes at a coastal campsite in Tarragona, Spain killing 216 tourists.
Events.text: Los Alfaques Disaster: A truck carrying liquid gas crashes and explodes at a coastal campsite in Tarragona, Spain killing 216 tourists.

Events.html: 1979 – America's first space station, Skylab, is destroyed as it re-enters the Earth's atmosphere over the Indian Ocean.
Events.text: America's first space station, Skylab, is destroyed as it re-enters the Earth's atmosphere over the Indian Ocean.

Events.html: 1990 – Oka Crisis: First Nations land dispute in Quebec, Canada begins.
Events.text: Oka Crisis: First Nations land dispute in Quebec, Canada begins.

Events.html: 1995 – The Srebrenica massacre is carried out.
Events.text: The Srebrenica massacre is carried out.

Events.html: 2006 – Mumbai train bombings: Two hundred nine people are killed in a series of bomb attacks in Mumbai, India.
Events.text: Mumbai train bombings: Two hundred nine people are killed in a series of bomb attacks in Mumbai, India.

Events.html: 2012 – Astronomers announce the discovery of Styx, the fifth moon of Pluto.
Events.text: Astronomers announce the discovery of Styx, the fifth moon of Pluto.
